metadata.Title: CVE-2023-1233 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Insufficient policy enforcement in Resource Timing in Google Chrome prior to 111.0.5563.64 allowed an attacker who convinced a user to install a malicious extension to obtain potentially sensitive information from API via a crafted Chrome Extension. (Chromium security severity: Low)

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-1233` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 111.0.5563.64-0ubuntu0.18.04.5
chromium-browser-l10n - 111.0.5563.64-0ubuntu0.18.04.5
chromium-chromedriver - 111.0.5563.64-0ubuntu0.18.04.5
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 111.0.5563.64-0ubuntu0.18.04.5
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 111.0.5563.64-0ubuntu0.18.04.5
No subscription required

notes.Note: alexmurray> The Debian chromium source package is called chromium-browser in Ubuntu mdeslaur> starting with Ubuntu 19.10, the chromium-browser package is just a script that installs the Chromium snap

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '111.0.5563.64-0ubuntu0.18.04.5').
